blocks.name: df-mpl
blocks.content: Define the subalgebra of the power series algebra generated by the variables; this is the polynomial algebra (the set of power series with finite degree). (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 7-Jan-2015.) (Revised by AV, 25-Jun-2019.)
blocks.origin:
axiom df-mpl(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3) {
  |- wceq(cmpl, cmpo(s0, s1, universe, universe, csb(s2, co(cv(s0), cmps, cv(s1)), co(cv(s2), cress, crab(s3, cfv(cbs, cv(s2)), wbr(cv(s3), cfsupp, cfv(c0g, cv(s1))))))))
  -| diffss(s0, s3)

  -| diffss(s2, s3)
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
}

  |- wrel(cdm(cmps))

blocks.name: psrvalstr
blocks.content: The multivariate power series structure is a function. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 8-Feb-2015.)

thm psrvalstr(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5) {
  |- wbr(cun(ctp(cop(cfv(cbs, cnx), c0), cop(cfv(cplusg, cnx), c1), cop(cfv(cmulr, cnx), c2)), ctp(cop(cfv(csca, cnx), c3), cop(cfv(cvsca, cnx), c4), cop(cfv(cts, cnx), c5))), cstr, cop(nat1, nat9))
} = {
  strleun(ctp(cop(cfv(cbs, cnx), c0), cop(cfv(cplusg, cnx), c1), cop(cfv(cmulr, cnx), c2)), ctp(cop(cfv(csca, cnx), c3), cop(cfv(cvsca, cnx), c4), cop(cfv(cts, cnx), c5)), nat1, nat9, nat3, nat5)
  rngstr(ctp(cop(cfv(cbs, cnx), c0), cop(cfv(cplusg, cnx), c1), cop(cfv(cmulr, cnx), c2)), c0, c1, c2)
  eqid(ctp(cop(cfv(cbs, cnx), c0), cop(cfv(cplusg, cnx), c1), cop(cfv(cmulr, cnx), c2)))
  strle3(cfv(csca, cnx), c3, cfv(cvsca, cnx), c4, cfv(cts, cnx), c5, nat5, nat9, nat6)
  5nn()
  scandx()
  5lt6()
  6nn()
  vscandx()
  6lt9()
  9nn()
  tsetndx()
  3lt5()
}

  mpan(wcel(c0, c1), wb(wcel(c2, co(cn0, cmap, c0)), wf(c2, c0, cn0)), wcel(cn0, universe))

  ‚ä¢ (c0 ‚àà c1 ‚Üí(c2 ‚àà c3 ‚Üî((c2 : c0 ‚Üí ‚Ñï0)‚àß(`' c2 " ‚Ñï)‚àà Fin)))

} = {
  syl5bb(c0 ‚àà c1, c2 ‚àà c3, ((c2 : c0 ‚Üí ‚Ñï0)‚àß(`' c2 " ‚Ñï)‚àà Fin), (c2 ‚àà(‚Ñï0[‚Ü¶]c0)‚àß(`' c2 " ‚Ñï)‚àà Fin))
  elrab2(s0, c2, c3, (‚Ñï0[‚Ü¶]c0), (`' c2 " ‚Ñï)‚àà Fin, (`' s0 " ‚Ñï)‚àà Fin)
  eleq1d((`' s0 " ‚Ñï), cfn, (`' c2 " ‚Ñï), s0 = c2)
  imaeq1d(`' s0, cn, `' c2, s0 = c2)
  cnveq(s0, c2)
  anbi1d(c0 ‚àà c1, c2 ‚àà(‚Ñï0[‚Ü¶]c0), (`' c2 " ‚Ñï)‚àà Fin, (c2 : c0 ‚Üí ‚Ñï0))
  mpan(c0 ‚àà c1, (c2 ‚àà(‚Ñï0[‚Ü¶]c0)‚Üî(c2 : c0 ‚Üí ‚Ñï0)), ‚Ñï0 ‚àà ùïå)
  nn0ex()
  elmapg(cn0, universe, c0, c1, c2)
  diff.co.s(s0, cn0, cmap, c0)
  diff.cn0.s(s0)
  diff.cmap.s(s0)
  diff.wcel.s(s0, (`' c2 " ‚Ñï), cfn)
  diff.cima.s(s0, `' c2, cn)
  diff.ccnv.s(s0, c2)

blocks.content: A bag containing one element is a finite bag. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 7-Jan-2015.) (Revised by AV, 8-Jul-2019.)

  adantr(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, cn0), wbr(cmpt(s0, c0, cif(c2, nat0, wceq(cv(s0), c3))), cfsupp, nat0))
  sniffsupp(s0, cmpt(s0, c0, cif(c2, nat0, wceq(cv(s0), c3))), nat0, c0, c1, universe, c3, c2, wcel(c0, c1))
  id(wcel(c0, c1))

  c0ex()
  eqid(cmpt(s0, c0, cif(c2, nat0, wceq(cv(s0), c3))))
  mpdan(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, cn0)), wb(wcel(cima(ccnv(cmpt(s0, c0, cif(c2, nat0, wceq(cv(s0), c3)))), cn), cfn), wbr(cmpt(s0, c0, cif(c2, nat0, wceq(cv(s0), c3))), cfsupp, nat0)), wf(cmpt(s0, c0, cif(c2, nat0, wceq(cv(s0), c3))), c0, cn0))
  fmpttd(s0, c0, cif(c2, nat0, wceq(cv(s0), c3)), cn0, wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, cn0)))
  adantr(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, cn0)), wcel(cv(s0), c0), wcel(cif(c2, nat0, wceq(cv(s0), c3)), cn0))
  ifcld(c2, nat0, cn0, wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, cn0)), wceq(cv(s0), c3))
  simpr(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, cn0))

  0nn0()
  bicomd(wa(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, cn0)), wf(cmpt(s0, c0, cif(c2, nat0, wceq(cv(s0), c3))), c0, cn0)), wcel(cima(ccnv(cmpt(s0, c0, cif(c2, nat0, wceq(cv(s0), c3)))), cn), cfn), wbr(cmpt(s0, c0, cif(c2, nat0, wceq(cv(s0), c3))), cfsupp, nat0))
  adantlr(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, cn0), wf(cmpt(s0, c0, cif(c2, nat0, wceq(cv(s0), c3))), c0, cn0), wb(wbr(cmpt(s0, c0, cif(c2, nat0, wceq(cv(s0), c3))), cfsupp, nat0), wcel(cima(ccnv(cmpt(s0, c0, cif(c2, nat0, wceq(cv(s0), c3)))), cn), cfn)))
  frnnn0fsupp(c0, c1, cmpt(s0, c0, cif(c2, nat0, wceq(cv(s0), c3))))

blocks.name: fczpsrbag
blocks.content: The constant function equal to zero is a finite bag. (Contributed by AV, 8-Jul-2019.)

thm fczpsrbag(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(cmpt(s0, c0, nat0), c2))
  -| wceq(c2, crab(s1, co(cn0, cmap, c0), wcel(cima(ccnv(cv(s1)), cn), cfn)))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
} = {
  eqeltrd(cmpt(s0, c0, nat0), c2, cmpt(s0, c0, cif(nat0, nat0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(hs0)))), wcel(c0, c1))
  mpteq2dv(s0, c0, nat0, cif(nat0, nat0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(hs0))), wcel(c0, c1))
  a1i(wcel(c0, c1), wceq(nat0, cif(nat0, nat0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(hs0)))))
  eqcomi(nat0, cif(nat0, nat0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(hs0))))
  ifid(nat0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(hs0)))
  mpan2(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(cmpt(s0, c0, cif(nat0, nat0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(hs0)))), c2), wcel(nat0, cn0))
  0nn0()
  snifpsrbag(s0, s1, c0, c1, nat0, cv(hs0), c2)
  diff.wcel.s(s0, c0, c1)
  diff.nat0.s(s0)
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diff.nat0.s(s1)
  diff.cv.s(s1, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s1, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s1)
}

  -| diffsc(s0, c0)

  a1ii(wi(wa(wcel(c0, c1), w3a(wcel(c2, c3), wf(c4, c0, cn0), wbr(c4, cofr(cle), c2))), wss(cima(ccnv(c4), cn), cima(ccnv(c2), cn))), diffsc(s0, c4))

  frnnn0supp(c0, c1, c4)
  suppss(hs0, c4, nat0, cima(ccnv(c2), cn), c0, cn0, wa(wcel(c0, c1), w3a(wcel(c2, c3), wf(c4, c0, cn0), wbr(c4, cofr(cle), c2))))
  mpbir2and(wa(wa(wcel(c0, c1), w3a(wcel(c2, c3), wf(c4, c0, cn0), wbr(c4, cofr(cle), c2))), wcel(cv(hs0), cdif(c0, cima(ccnv(c2), cn)))), wceq(cfv(c4, cv(hs0)), nat0), wbr(cfv(c4, cv(hs0)), cle, nat0), wbr(nat0, cle, cfv(c4, cv(hs0))))
  breqtrd(cfv(c4, cv(hs0)), cle, nat0, cfv(c2, cv(hs0)), wa(wa(wcel(c0, c1), w3a(wcel(c2, c3), wf(c4, c0, cn0), wbr(c4, cofr(cle), c2))), wcel(cv(hs0), cdif(c0, cima(ccnv(c2), cn)))))
  sylan2(wa(wcel(c0, c1), w3a(wcel(c2, c3), wf(c4, c0, cn0), wbr(c4, cofr(cle), c2))), wcel(cv(hs0), cdif(c0, cima(ccnv(c2), cn))), wbr(cfv(c4, cv(hs0)), cle, cfv(c2, cv(hs0))), wcel(cv(hs0), c0))
  r19.21bi(hs0, c0, wa(wcel(c0, c1), w3a(wcel(c2, c3), wf(c4, c0, cn0), wbr(c4, cofr(cle), c2))), wbr(cfv(c4, cv(hs0)), cle, cfv(c2, cv(hs0))))
  mpbid(wa(wcel(c0, c1), w3a(wcel(c2, c3), wf(c4, c0, cn0), wbr(c4, cofr(cle), c2))), wral(hs0, c0, wbr(cfv(c4, cv(hs0)), cle, cfv(c2, cv(hs0)))), wbr(c4, cofr(cle), c2))
  simpr3(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c3), wf(c4, c0, cn0), wbr(c4, cofr(cle), c2))
  ofrfval(hs0, c4, cle, c2, c0, cfv(c4, cv(hs0)), cfv(c2, cv(hs0)), c0, c0, c1, c1, wa(wcel(c0, c1), w3a(wcel(c2, c3), wf(c4, c0, cn0), wbr(c4, cofr(cle), c2))))
  ffnd(c4, c0, cn0, wa(wcel(c0, c1), w3a(wcel(c2, c3), wf(c4, c0, cn0), wbr(c4, cofr(cle), c2))))
  ffnd(c2, c0, cn0, wa(wcel(c0, c1), w3a(wcel(c2, c3), wf(c4, c0, cn0), wbr(c4, cofr(cle), c2))))
  inidm(c0)

  mpbid(wa(wcel(c0, c1), w3a(wcel(c2, c3), wf(c4, c0, cn0), wbr(c4, cofr(cle), c2))), wa(wf(c2, c0, cn0), wcel(cima(ccnv(c2), cn), cfn)), wcel(c2, c3))
  simpr1(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c3), wf(c4, c0, cn0), wbr(c4, cofr(cle), c2))
  adantr(wcel(c0, c1), w3a(wcel(c2, c3), wf(c4, c0, cn0), wbr(c4, cofr(cle), c2)), wb(wcel(c2, c3), wa(wf(c2, c0, cn0), wcel(cima(ccnv(c2), cn), cfn))))

blocks.name: psrbagcon
blocks.content: The analogue of the statement " ` 0 <_ G <_ F ` implies ` 0 <_ F - G <_ F ` " for finite bags. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 29-Dec-2014.)

  eqeltrd(cfv(co(c2, cof(cmin), c4), cv(hs0)), cn0, co(cfv(c2, cv(hs0)), cmin, cfv(c4, cv(hs0))), wa(wa(wcel(c0, c1), w3a(wcel(c2, c3), wf(c4, c0, cn0), wbr(c4, cofr(cle), c2))), wcel(cv(hs0), c0)))

blocks.content: There are finitely many bags dominated by a given bag. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 29-Dec-2014.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 25-Jan-2015.)

thm psrbaglefi(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {

  -| wceq(c3, crab(s1, co(cn0, cmap, c0), wcel(cima(ccnv(cv(s1)), cn), cfn)))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)

  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c3)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c2)
} = {
  eqeltrd(crab(s0, c3, wbr(cv(s0), cofr(cle), c2)), cfn, cixp(hs0, c0, co(nat0, cfz, cfv(c2, cv(hs0)))), wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c3)))

blocks.name: gsumbagdiag
blocks.content: Two-dimensional commutation of a group sum over a "triangular" region. ~ fsum0diag analogue for finite bags. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 5-Jan-2015.)

blocks.name: psrbas
blocks.content: The base set of the multivariate power series structure. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 28-Dec-2014.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 2-Oct-2015.) (Proof shortened by AV, 8-Jul-2019.)

blocks.name: psrelbas
blocks.content: An element of the set of power series is a function on the coefficients. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 28-Dec-2014.)
blocks.origin:
thm psrelbas(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wf(c0, c1, c2))
  -| wceq(c3, co(c4, cmps, c5))
  -| wceq(c2, cfv(cbs, c5))
  -| wceq(c1, crab(s0, co(cn0, cmap, c4), wcel(cima(ccnv(cv(s0)), cn), cfn)))
  -| wceq(c6, cfv(cbs, c3))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c0, c6))
  -| diffsc(s0, c4)
} = {
  sylib(w0, wf(c0, c1, c2), wcel(c0, co(c2, cmap, c1)))
  eleqtrd(c0, co(c2, cmap, c1), c6, w0)
  psrbas(s0, c6, c2, c1, c3, c4, c5, universe, w0)
  simpld(w0, wcel(c4, universe), wcel(c5, universe))
  syl(w0, wa(wcel(c4, universe), wcel(c5, universe)), wcel(c0, c6))
  elbasov(c0, c6, c4, c5, cmps, c3)
  reldmpsr()
  elmap(c0, c2, c1)
  fvexi(c2, cbs, c5)
  rabex2(s0, c1, co(cn0, cmap, c4), wcel(cima(ccnv(cv(s0)), cn), cfn))
  ovex(cn0, cmap, c4)
  diff.co.s(s0, cn0, cmap, c4)
  diff.cn0.s(s0)
  diff.cmap.s(s0)
}

blocks.name: psradd
blocks.content: The addition operation of the multivariate power series structure. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 28-Dec-2014.)
blocks.origin:
thm psradd(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, class c7, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wceq(co(c0, c1, c2), co(c0, cof(c3), c2)))
  -| wceq(c4, co(c5, cmps, c6))
  -| wceq(c7, cfv(cbs, c4))
  -| wceq(c3, cfv(cplusg, c6))
  -| wceq(c1, cfv(cplusg, c4))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c0, c7))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c2, c7))
} = {
  syl5eq(co(c0, c1, c2), co(c0, cof(c3), c2), co(c0, cres(cof(c3), cxp(c7, c7)), c2), w0)
  oveqi(c0, c1, c2, cres(cof(c3), cxp(c7, c7)))
  psrplusg(c1, c3, c7, c4, c5, c6)
  ofmresval(c0, c3, c7, c7, c2, w0)
}

  ‚ä¢ (w0 ‚Üí(c0[c1]c2)=(c0[oF(c3)]c2))
  ‚ä£ c4 =(c5[mPwSer]c6)
  ‚ä£ c7 =(Base ` c4)
  ‚ä£ c3 =(+ ` c6)
  ‚ä£ c1 =(+ ` c4)
  ‚ä£ (w0 ‚Üí c0 ‚àà c7)
  ‚ä£ (w0 ‚Üí c2 ‚àà c7)
} = {
  syl5eq((c0[c1]c2), (c0[oF(c3)]c2), (c0[(oF(c3)|`(c7 √ó c7))]c2), w0)
  oveqi(c0, c1, c2, (oF(c3)|`(c7 √ó c7)))
  psrplusg(c1, c3, c7, c4, c5, c6)
  ofmresval(c0, c3, c7, c7, c2, w0)
}

blocks.name: psraddcl

blocks.name: psr1cl
blocks.content: The identity element of the ring of power series. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 29-Dec-2014.)

thm psr1cl(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, class c7, class c8, wff w0) {

  -| wceq(c6, crab(s0, co(cn0, cmap, c3), wcel(cima(ccnv(cv(s0)), cn), cfn)))
  -| wceq(c7, cfv(c0g, c4))
  -| wceq(c8, cfv(cur, c4))
  -| wceq(c0, cmpt(s1, c6, cif(c8, c7, wceq(cv(s1), cxp(c3, csn(nat0))))))
  -| wceq(c1, cfv(cbs, c2))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c3)
  -| diffsc(s0, c4)
  -| diffsc(s0, c7)
  -| diffsc(s1, c1)

  -| diffsc(s1, c4)
  -| diffsc(s1, c5)
  -| diffsc(s1, c6)
  -| diffsc(s1, c7)
  -| diffsc(s1, c8)
  -| diffsw(s1, w0)
} = {
  a1ii(wi(w0, wcel(c0, c1)), diffss(s0, s1))
  a1ii(wi(w0, wcel(c0, c1)), diffsc(s0, c4))
  a1ii(wi(w0, wcel(c0, c1)), diffsc(s0, c7))
  a1ii(wi(w0, wcel(c0, c1)), diffsc(s1, c1))

  a1ii(wi(w0, wcel(c0, c1)), diffsc(s1, c7))
  a1ii(wi(w0, wcel(c0, c1)), diffsc(s1, c8))

  syl(w0, wcel(cif(c8, c7, wceq(cv(s1), cxp(c3, csn(nat0)))), cfv(cbs, c4)), wcel(c4, crg))
  ifcld(c8, c7, cfv(cbs, c4), wcel(c4, crg), wceq(cv(s1), cxp(c3, csn(nat0))))

  ovex(cn0, cmap, c3)

thm psr1cl(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, class c7, class c8, wff w0) {
  ‚ä¢ (w0 ‚Üí c0 ‚àà c1)
  ‚ä£ c2 =(c3[mPwSer]c4)
  ‚ä£ (w0 ‚Üí c3 ‚àà c5)
  ‚ä£ (w0 ‚Üí c4 ‚àà Ring)
  ‚ä£ c6 = { s0 ‚àà(‚Ñï0[‚Ü¶]c3)|(`' s0 " ‚Ñï)‚àà Fin }
  ‚ä£ c7 =(0 ` c4)
  ‚ä£ c8 =(1r ` c4)
  ‚ä£ c0 =(s1 ‚àà c6 ‚Ü¶ if(s1 =(c3 √ó { 0 }), c8, c7))
  ‚ä£ c1 =(Base ` c2)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s1)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c3)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c4)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c7)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, c1)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, c2)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, c3)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, c4)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, c5)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, c6)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, c7)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, c8)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, w0)
} = {
  a1ii((w0 ‚Üí c0 ‚àà c1), d(s0, s1))
  a1ii((w0 ‚Üí c0 ‚àà c1), d(s0, c4))
  a1ii((w0 ‚Üí c0 ‚àà c1), d(s0, c7))
  a1ii((w0 ‚Üí c0 ‚àà c1), d(s1, c1))
  a1ii((w0 ‚Üí c0 ‚àà c1), d(s1, c2))
  a1ii((w0 ‚Üí c0 ‚àà c1), d(s1, c3))
  a1ii((w0 ‚Üí c0 ‚àà c1), d(s1, c5))
  a1ii((w0 ‚Üí c0 ‚àà c1), d(s1, c7))
  a1ii((w0 ‚Üí c0 ‚àà c1), d(s1, c8))
  eleqtrrd(c0, c1, ((Base ` c4)[‚Ü¶]c6), w0)
  sylibr(w0, c0 ‚àà((Base ` c4)[‚Ü¶]c6), (c0 : c6 ‚Üí(Base ` c4)))
  fmptd(s1, c0, c6, (Base ` c4), if(s1 =(c3 √ó { 0 }), c8, c7), w0)
  adantr(w0, s1 ‚àà c6, if(s1 =(c3 √ó { 0 }), c8, c7)‚àà(Base ` c4))
  syl(w0, if(s1 =(c3 √ó { 0 }), c8, c7)‚àà(Base ` c4), c4 ‚àà Ring)
  ifcld(c8, c7, (Base ` c4), c4 ‚àà Ring, s1 =(c3 √ó { 0 }))
  ringidcl(c4, c8, (Base ` c4))
  ring0cl(c4, c7, (Base ` c4))
  elmap(c0, (Base ` c4), c6)
  fvex(cbs, c4)
  rabex2(s0, c6, (‚Ñï0[‚Ü¶]c3), (`' s0 " ‚Ñï)‚àà Fin)
  ovex(cn0, cmap, c3)
  psrbas(s0, c1, (Base ` c4), c6, c2, c3, c4, c5, w0)
  eqid((Base ` c4))
  diff.cfv.s(s1, cbs, c4)
  diff.cbs.s(s1)
  diff.co.s(s0, cn0, cmap, c3)
  diff.cn0.s(s0)
  diff.cmap.s(s0)
}

blocks.name: psrlidm
blocks.content: The identity element of the ring of power series is a left identity. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 29-Dec-2014.) (Proof shortened by AV, 8-Jul-2019.)

blocks.name: psrridm
blocks.content: The identity element of the ring of power series is a right identity. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 29-Dec-2014.) (Proof shortened by AV, 8-Jul-2019.)
blocks.origin:
thm psrridm(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, class c7, class c8, class c9, class c10, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wceq(co(c0, c1, c2), c0))
  -| wceq(c3, co(c4, cmps, c5))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c4, c6))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c5, crg))
  -| wceq(c7, crab(s0, co(cn0, cmap, c4), wcel(cima(ccnv(cv(s0)), cn), cfn)))
  -| wceq(c8, cfv(c0g, c5))
  -| wceq(c9, cfv(cur, c5))
  -| wceq(c2, cmpt(s1, c7, cif(c9, c8, wceq(cv(s1), cxp(c4, csn(nat0))))))
  -| wceq(c10, cfv(cbs, c3))
  -| wceq(c1, cfv(cmulr, c3))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c0, c10))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c4)
  -| diffsc(s0, c5)
  -| diffsc(s0, c8)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c1)
  -| diffsc(s1, c10)
  -| diffsc(s1, c3)
  -| diffsc(s1, c4)
  -| diffsc(s1, c5)
  -| diffsc(s1, c6)
  -| diffsc(s1, c7)
  -| diffsc(s1, c8)
  -| diffsc(s1, c9)
  -| diffsw(s1, w0)
} = {
  a1ii(wi(w0, wceq(co(c0, c1, c2), c0)), diffsc(s0, c0))
  a1ii(wi(w0, wceq(co(c0, c1, c2), c0)), diffsc(s1, c0))
  a1ii(wi(w0, wceq(co(c0, c1, c2), c0)), diffsc(s1, c1))
  eqfnfvd(hs0, co(c0, c1, c2), c0, c7, w0)
  ffnd(co(c0, c1, c2), c7, cfv(cbs, c5), w0)
  psrelbas(s0, co(c0, c1, c2), c7, cfv(cbs, c5), c3, c4, c5, c10, w0)

blocks.name: psrdir
blocks.content: Distributive law for the ring of power series (right-distributivity). (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 7-Jan-2015.)

blocks.name: psrass23l
blocks.content: Associative identity for the ring of power series. Part of ~ psrass23 which does not require the scalar ring to be commutative. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 7-Jan-2015.) (Revised by AV, 14-Aug-2019.)

blocks.name: psrass23
blocks.content: Associative identities for the ring of power series. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 7-Jan-2015.) (Proof shortened by AV, 25-Nov-2019.)
blocks.origin:

blocks.content: The ring of power series is a ring. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 29-Dec-2014.)

  fvex(cbs, c4)
  adantr(w0, wcel(c3, universe), wss(cfv(cbs, c5), cfv(cbs, c4)))
  eqsstr3d(cfv(cbs, c5), cfv(cbs, c4), c6, w0)

  psrbas(hs0, c0, cfv(cbs, c5), crab(hs0, co(cn0, cmap, c3), wcel(cima(ccnv(cv(hs0)), cn), cfn)), c7, c3, c5, universe, wa(w0, wcel(c3, universe)))

  eqid(cfv(cbs, c4))

blocks.content: Base set of the set of multivariate polynomials. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 7-Jan-2015.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 2-Oct-2015.) (Revised by AV, 25-Jun-2019.)

thm mplbas(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6) {
  |- wceq(c0, crab(s0, c1, wbr(cv(s0), cfsupp, c2)))
  -| wceq(c3, co(c4, cmpl, c5))
  -| wceq(c6, co(c4, cmps, c5))
  -| wceq(c1, cfv(cbs, c6))
  -| wceq(c2, cfv(c0g, c5))
  -| wceq(c0, cfv(cbs, c3))
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c4)
  -| diffsc(s0, c5)
} = {
  eqtr4i(c0, crab(s0, c1, wbr(cv(s0), cfsupp, c2)), cfv(cbs, c3))
  ax-mp(wceq(crab(s0, c1, wbr(cv(s0), cfsupp, c2)), cfv(cbs, c3)), wss(crab(s0, c1, wbr(cv(s0), cfsupp, c2)), c1))
  ssrab2(s0, c1, wbr(cv(s0), cfsupp, c2))
  ressbas2(crab(s0, c1, wbr(cv(s0), cfsupp, c2)), c1, c3, c6)
  mplval(s0, c3, c6, crab(s0, c1, wbr(cv(s0), cfsupp, c2)), c4, c5, c1, c2)
  eqid(crab(s0, c1, wbr(cv(s0), cfsupp, c2)))
}

  ‚ä£ c2 =(Base ` c0)

  mplval(hs0, c0, c1, c2, c3, c4, (Base ` c1), (0 ` c4))
  mplbas(hs0, c2, (Base ` c1), (0 ` c4), c0, c3, c4, c1)
  eqid((Base ` c1))
  eqid((0 ` c4))
  diff.hs0.c(c3)
  diff.hs0.c(c4)

  diff.hs0.c((0 ` c4))

blocks.name: mplbasss
blocks.content: The set of polynomials is a subset of the set of power series. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 7-Jan-2015.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 2-Oct-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm mplbasss(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5) {
  |- wss(c0, c1)
  -| wceq(c2, co(c3, cmpl, c4))
  -| wceq(c5, co(c3, cmps, c4))
  -| wceq(c0, cfv(cbs, c2))
  -| wceq(c1, cfv(cbs, c5))
} = {
  ssrab3(hs0, c0, c1, wbr(cv(hs0), cfsupp, cfv(c0g, c4)))
  mplbas(hs0, c0, c1, cfv(c0g, c4), c2, c3, c4, c5)
  eqid(cfv(c0g, c4))
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.c(cfv(c0g, c4))
  diff.hs0.c(c3)
  diff.hs0.c(c4)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm mplbasss(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5) {
  ‚ä¢ c0 ‚äÜ c1
  ‚ä£ c2 =(c3[mPoly]c4)
  ‚ä£ c5 =(c3[mPwSer]c4)
  ‚ä£ c0 =(Base ` c2)
  ‚ä£ c1 =(Base ` c5)
} = {
  ssrab3(hs0, c0, c1, hs0[finSupp](0 ` c4))
  mplbas(hs0, c0, c1, (0 ` c4), c2, c3, c4, c5)
  eqid((0 ` c4))
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.c((0 ` c4))
  diff.hs0.c(c3)
  diff.hs0.c(c4)
}

blocks.name: mplelf
blocks.content: A polynomial is defined as a function on the coefficients. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 7-Jan-2015.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 2-Oct-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm mplelf(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wf(c0, c1, c2))
  -| wceq(c3, co(c4, cmpl, c5))
  -| wceq(c2, cfv(cbs, c5))
  -| wceq(c6, cfv(cbs, c3))
  -| wceq(c1, crab(s0, co(cn0, cmap, c4), wcel(cima(ccnv(cv(s0)), cn), cfn)))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c0, c6))
  -| diffsc(s0, c4)
} = {
  psrelbas(s0, c0, c1, c2, co(c4, cmps, c5), c4, c5, cfv(cbs, co(c4, cmps, c5)), w0)
  sseldi(c0, cfv(cbs, co(c4, cmps, c5)), c6, w0)
  mplbasss(c6, cfv(cbs, co(c4, cmps, c5)), c3, c4, c5, co(c4, cmps, c5))
  eqid(co(c4, cmps, c5))
  eqid(cfv(cbs, co(c4, cmps, c5)))
}

blocks.name: mplsubglem
blocks.content: If ` A ` is an ideal of sets (a nonempty collection closed under subset and binary union) of the set ` D ` of finite bags (the primary applications being ` A = Fin ` and ` A = ~P B ` for some ` B ` ), then the set of all power series whose coefficient functions are supported on an element of ` A ` is a subgroup of the set of all power series. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 12-Jan-2015.) (Revised by AV, 16-Jul-2019.)

blocks.name: mpllsslem
blocks.content: If ` A ` is an ideal of subsets (a nonempty collection closed under subset and binary union) of the set ` D ` of finite bags (the primary applications being ` A = Fin ` and ` A = ~P B ` for some ` B ` ), then the set of all power series whose coefficient functions are supported on an element of ` A ` is a linear subspace of the set of all power series. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 12-Jan-2015.) (Revised by AV, 16-Jul-2019.)

thm mplsubglem2(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wceq(c0, crab(s0, cfv(cbs, c1), wcel(co(cv(s0), csupp, cfv(c0g, c2)), cfn))))
  -| wceq(c1, co(c3, cmps, c2))
  -| wceq(c4, co(c3, cmpl, c2))
  -| wceq(c0, cfv(cbs, c4))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c3, c5))
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c3)
  -| diffsw(s0, w0)
} = {
  a1ii(wi(w0, wceq(c0, crab(s0, cfv(cbs, c1), wcel(co(cv(s0), csupp, cfv(c0g, c2)), cfn)))), wi(w0, wcel(c3, c5)))
  syl5eq(c0, crab(s0, cfv(cbs, c1), wcel(co(cv(s0), csupp, cfv(c0g, c2)), cfn)), crab(s0, cfv(cbs, c1), wbr(cv(s0), cfsupp, cfv(c0g, c2))), w0)
  mplbas(s0, c0, cfv(cbs, c1), cfv(c0g, c2), c4, c3, c2, c1)
  eqid(cfv(c0g, c2))
  rabbidva(s0, cfv(cbs, c1), w0, wbr(cv(s0), cfsupp, cfv(c0g, c2)), wcel(co(cv(s0), csupp, cfv(c0g, c2)), cfn))
  syl3anc(wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), cfv(cbs, c1))), wb(wbr(cv(s0), cfsupp, cfv(c0g, c2)), wcel(co(cv(s0), csupp, cfv(c0g, c2)), cfn)), wfun(cv(s0)), wcel(cv(s0), cfv(cbs, c1)), wcel(cfv(c0g, c2), universe))
  adantl(w0, wcel(cv(s0), cfv(cbs, c1)), wfun(cv(s0)))
  psrelbasfun(cv(s0), cfv(cbs, c1), c1, c3, c2)
  eqid(cfv(cbs, c1))
  simpr(w0, wcel(cv(s0), cfv(cbs, c1)))
  fvexd(c0g, c2, wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), cfv(cbs, c1))))

}

blocks.name: mplsubrg
blocks.content: The set of polynomials is closed under multiplication, i.e. it is a subring of the set of power series. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 9-Jan-2015.)

thm mpl0(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wceq(c0, cxp(c1, csn(c2))))
  -| wceq(c3, co(c4, cmpl, c5))

  -| wceq(c2, cfv(c0g, c5))

  -| wi(w0, wcel(c4, c6))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c5, cgrp))
  -| diffsc(s0, c4)
} = {
  syl5eq(c0, cxp(c1, csn(c2)), cfv(c0g, c3), w0)
  eqtr3d(cfv(c0g, c3), cxp(c1, csn(c2)), cfv(c0g, co(c4, cmps, c5)), w0)
  syl(w0, wceq(cfv(c0g, co(c4, cmps, c5)), cfv(c0g, c3)), wcel(cfv(cbs, c3), cfv(csubg, co(c4, cmps, c5))))

  subg0(cfv(cbs, c3), co(c4, cmps, c5), cfv(c0g, co(c4, cmps, c5)), c3)
  mplval2(c3, co(c4, cmps, c5), cfv(cbs, c3), c4, c5)
  eqid(cfv(cbs, c3))
  psr0(s0, cfv(c0g, co(c4, cmps, c5)), c1, c2, co(c4, cmps, c5), c4, c5, c6, w0)
  eqid(co(c4, cmps, c5))
  eqid(cfv(c0g, co(c4, cmps, c5)))
}

thm mpladd(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, class c7, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wceq(co(c0, c1, c2), co(c0, cof(c3), c2)))
  -| wceq(c4, co(c5, cmpl, c6))
  -| wceq(c7, cfv(cbs, c4))
  -| wceq(c3, cfv(cplusg, c6))
  -| wceq(c1, cfv(cplusg, c4))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c0, c7))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c2, c7))
} = {
  psradd(c0, c1, c2, c3, co(c5, cmps, c6), c5, c6, cfv(cbs, co(c5, cmps, c6)), w0)
  eqtr4i(c1, cfv(cplusg, co(c5, cmps, c6)), cfv(cplusg, c4))

  mplval2(c4, co(c5, cmps, c6), c7, c5, c6)
  eqid(cfv(cplusg, co(c5, cmps, c6)))
  sseldi(c0, cfv(cbs, co(c5, cmps, c6)), c7, w0)
  sseldi(c2, cfv(cbs, co(c5, cmps, c6)), c7, w0)
  mplbasss(c7, cfv(cbs, co(c5, cmps, c6)), c4, c5, c6, co(c5, cmps, c6))
  eqid(co(c5, cmps, c6))
  eqid(cfv(cbs, co(c5, cmps, c6)))
}

blocks.name: ressmplbas2

  ineq2i(c1, c2, cin(cfv(cbs, co(c4, cmps, c5)), cab(hs0, wbr(cv(hs0), cfsupp, cfv(c0g, c5)))))
  eqtri(c2, cin(cfv(cbs, co(c4, cmps, c5)), cab(hs0, wbr(cv(hs0), cfsupp, cfv(c0g, c5)))), crab(hs0, cfv(cbs, co(c4, cmps, c5)), wbr(cv(hs0), cfsupp, cfv(c0g, c5))))

blocks.name: mplmonmul
blocks.content: The product of two monomials adds the exponent vectors together. For example, the product of ` ( x ^ 2 ) ( y ^ 2 ) ` with ` ( y ^ 1 ) ( z ^ 3 ) ` is ` ( x ^ 2 ) ( y ^ 3 ) ( z ^ 3 ) ` , where the exponent vectors ` <. 2 , 2 , 0 >. ` and ` <. 0 , 1 , 3 >. ` are added to give ` <. 2 , 3 , 3 >. ` . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 9-Jan-2015.)

blocks.name: mplcoe1
blocks.content: Decompose a polynomial into a finite sum of monomials. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 9-Jan-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm mplcoe1(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, class c7, class c8, class c9, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wceq(c0, co(c1, cgsu, cmpt(s0, c2, co(cfv(c0, cv(s0)), c3, cmpt(s1, c2, cif(c4, c5, wceq(cv(s1), cv(s0)))))))))
  -| wceq(c1, co(c6, cmpl, c7))
  -| wceq(c2, crab(s2, co(cn0, cmap, c6), wcel(cima(ccnv(cv(s2)), cn), cfn)))
  -| wceq(c5, cfv(c0g, c7))
  -| wceq(c4, cfv(cur, c7))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c6, c8))
  -| wceq(c9, cfv(cbs, c1))
  -| wceq(c3, cfv(cvsca, c1))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c7, crg))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c0, c9))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c3)
  -| diffsc(s0, c4)
  -| diffsc(s0, c5)
  -| diffsc(s0, c6)
  -| diffsc(s0, c8)
  -| diffsc(s0, c9)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c2)
  -| diffsc(s1, c4)
  -| diffsc(s1, c5)
  -| diffsc(s1, c6)
  -| diffsc(s1, c7)
  -| diffsc(s1, c8)
  -| diffsc(s2, c0)
  -| diffsc(s2, c5)
  -| diffsc(s2, c6)
  -| diffsc(s2, c7)
  -| diffsw(s0, w0)
  -| diffsw(s1, w0)
} = {
  a1ii(wi(w0, wceq(c0, co(c1, cgsu, cmpt(s0, c2, co(cfv(c0, cv(s0)), c3, cmpt(s1, c2, cif(c4, c5, wceq(cv(s1), cv(s0))))))))), diffsc(s0, c6))
  a1ii(wi(w0, wceq(c0, co(c1, cgsu, cmpt(s0, c2, co(cfv(c0, cv(s0)), c3, cmpt(s1, c2, cif(c4, c5, wceq(cv(s1), cv(s0))))))))), diffsc(s0, c8))

blocks.name: mplcoe3
blocks.content: Decompose a monomial in one variable into a power of a variable. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 7-Jan-2015.) (Proof shortened by AV, 18-Jul-2019.)

blocks.name: mplcoe5
blocks.content: Decompose a monomial into a finite product of powers of variables. Instead of assuming that ` R ` is a commutative ring (as in ~ mplcoe2 ), it is sufficient that ` R ` is a ring and all the variables of the multivariate polynomial commute. (Contributed by AV, 7-Oct-2019.)
blocks.origin:

blocks.name: mplcoe2
blocks.content: Decompose a monomial into a finite product of powers of variables. (The assumption that ` R ` is a commutative ring is not strictly necessary, because the submonoid of monomials is in the center of the multiplicative monoid of polynomials, but it simplifies the proof.) (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 10-Jan-2015.) (Proof shortened by AV, 18-Oct-2019.)

blocks.content: Value of the well-order on finite bags. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 8-Feb-2015.)

blocks.content: Lemma for ordered power series. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 2-Oct-2015.)

thm reldmopsr() {

blocks.name: opsrval
blocks.content: The value of the "ordered power series" function. This is the same as ` mPwSer ` ~ psrval , but with the addition of a well-order on ` I ` we can turn a strict order on ` R ` into a strict order on the power series structure. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 8-Feb-2015.)

blocks.name: opsrle
blocks.content: An alternative expression for the set of polynomials, as the smallest subalgebra of the set of power series that contains all the variable generators. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 8-Feb-2015.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 2-Oct-2015.)

blocks.name: opsrbaslem
blocks.content: Get a component of the ordered power series structure. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 8-Feb-2015.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 2-Oct-2015.) (Revised by AV, 9-Sep-2021.)
blocks.origin:
thm opsrbaslem(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wceq(cfv(c0, c1), cfv(c0, c2)))
  -| wceq(c1, co(c3, cmps, c4))
  -| wceq(c2, cfv(co(c3, copws, c4), c5))
  -| wi(w0, wss(c5, cxp(c3, c3)))
  -| wceq(c0, cslot(c6))
  -| wcel(c6, cn)
  -| wbr(c6, clt, cdc(nat1, nat0))
} = {
  pm2.61dan(w0, wceq(cfv(c0, c1), cfv(c0, c2)), wa(wcel(c3, universe), wcel(c4, universe)))
  syl6reqr(cfv(c0, c1), cfv(c0, c2), cfv(c0, co(c1, csts, cop(cfv(cple, cnx), cfv(cple, c2)))), wa(w0, wa(wcel(c3, universe), wcel(c4, universe))))
  fveq2d(c0, c2, co(c1, csts, cop(cfv(cple, cnx), cfv(cple, c2))), wa(w0, wa(wcel(c3, universe), wcel(c4, universe))))
  opsrval2(c2, c1, cfv(cple, c2), c3, c4, c5, universe, universe, wa(w0, wa(wcel(c3, universe), wcel(c4, universe))))
  eqid(cfv(cple, c2))
  simprl(w0, wcel(c3, universe), wcel(c4, universe))
  simprr(w0, wcel(c3, universe), wcel(c4, universe))
  adantr(w0, wa(wcel(c3, universe), wcel(c4, universe)), wss(c5, cxp(c3, c3)))
  setsnid(c0, c1, cfv(cple, cnx), cfv(cple, c2))
  ndxid(c0, c6)
  mpbir(wne(cfv(c0, cnx), cfv(cple, cnx)), wne(c6, cdc(nat1, nat0)))
  ltneii(c6, cdc(nat1, nat0))
  nnrei(c6)
  neeq12i(cfv(c0, cnx), cfv(cple, cnx), c6, cdc(nat1, nat0))
  ndxarg(c0, c6)
  plendx()
  fveq2d(c0, c1, c2, wa(w0, wn(wa(wcel(c3, universe), wcel(c4, universe)))))
  3eqtr4g(c1, c2, co(c3, cmps, c4), cfv(co(c3, copws, c4), c5), wa(w0, wn(wa(wcel(c3, universe), wcel(c4, universe)))))
  adantl(w0, wn(wa(wcel(c3, universe), wcel(c4, universe))), wceq(co(c3, cmps, c4), cfv(co(c3, copws, c4), c5)))
  3eqtr4a(co(c3, cmps, c4), cfv(co(c3, copws, c4), c5), emptycls, cfv(emptycls, c5), wn(wa(wcel(c3, universe), wcel(c4, universe))))
  eqcomi(emptycls, cfv(emptycls, c5))
  0fv(c5)
  ovprc(c3, c4, cmps)
  reldmpsr()
  fveq1d(co(c3, copws, c4), c5, emptycls, wn(wa(wcel(c3, universe), wcel(c4, universe))))
  ovprc(c3, c4, copws)
  reldmopsr()
}

thm opsrbaslem(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, wff w0) {
  ‚ä¢ (w0 ‚Üí(c0 ` c1)=(c0 ` c2))
  ‚ä£ c1 =(c3[mPwSer]c4)
  ‚ä£ c2 =((c3[ordPwSer]c4)` c5)
  ‚ä£ (w0 ‚Üí c5 ‚äÜ(c3 √ó c3))
  ‚ä£ c0 = Slot(c6)
  ‚ä£ c6 ‚àà ‚Ñï
  ‚ä£ c6[<]cdc(1, 0)
} = {
  pm2.61dan(w0, (c0 ` c1)=(c0 ` c2), (c3 ‚àà ùïå ‚àß c4 ‚àà ùïå))
  syl6reqr((c0 ` c1), (c0 ` c2), (c0 `(c1[sSet]<(le ` ndx),(le ` c2)>)), (w0 ‚àß(c3 ‚àà ùïå ‚àß c4 ‚àà ùïå)))
  fveq2d(c0, c2, (c1[sSet]<(le ` ndx),(le ` c2)>), (w0 ‚àß(c3 ‚àà ùïå ‚àß c4 ‚àà ùïå)))
  opsrval2(c2, c1, (le ` c2), c3, c4, c5, universe, universe, (w0 ‚àß(c3 ‚àà ùïå ‚àß c4 ‚àà ùïå)))
  eqid((le ` c2))
  simprl(w0, c3 ‚àà ùïå, c4 ‚àà ùïå)
  simprr(w0, c3 ‚àà ùïå, c4 ‚àà ùïå)
  adantr(w0, (c3 ‚àà ùïå ‚àß c4 ‚àà ùïå), c5 ‚äÜ(c3 √ó c3))
  setsnid(c0, c1, (le ` ndx), (le ` c2))
  ndxid(c0, c6)
  mpbir((c0 ` ndx)‚â†(le ` ndx), c6 ‚â† cdc(1, 0))
  ltneii(c6, cdc(1, 0))
  nnrei(c6)
  neeq12i((c0 ` ndx), (le ` ndx), c6, cdc(1, 0))
  ndxarg(c0, c6)
  plendx()
  fveq2d(c0, c1, c2, (w0 ‚àß ¬¨(c3 ‚àà ùïå ‚àß c4 ‚àà ùïå)))
  3eqtr4g(c1, c2, (c3[mPwSer]c4), ((c3[ordPwSer]c4)` c5), (w0 ‚àß ¬¨(c3 ‚àà ùïå ‚àß c4 ‚àà ùïå)))
  adantl(w0, ¬¨(c3 ‚àà ùïå ‚àß c4 ‚àà ùïå), (c3[mPwSer]c4)=((c3[ordPwSer]c4)` c5))
  3eqtr4a((c3[mPwSer]c4), ((c3[ordPwSer]c4)` c5), emptycls, (‚àÖ ` c5), ¬¨(c3 ‚àà ùïå ‚àß c4 ‚àà ùïå))
  eqcomi(emptycls, (‚àÖ ` c5))
  0fv(c5)
  ovprc(c3, c4, cmps)
  reldmpsr()
  fveq1d((c3[ordPwSer]c4), c5, emptycls, ¬¨(c3 ‚àà ùïå ‚àß c4 ‚àà ùïå))
  ovprc(c3, c4, copws)
  reldmopsr()
}

thm opsrsca(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wceq(c0, cfv(csca, c1)))
  -| wceq(c2, co(c3, cmps, c0))
  -| wceq(c1, cfv(co(c3, copws, c0), c4))
  -| wi(w0, wss(c4, cxp(c3, c3)))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c3, c5))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c0, c6))
} = {
  eqtrd(c0, cfv(csca, c1), cfv(csca, c2), w0)
  psrsca(c0, c2, c3, c5, c6, w0)
  opsrbaslem(csca, c2, c1, c3, c0, c4, nat5, w0)
  df-sca()
  5nn()
  5lt10()
}

blocks.name: subrgasclcl
blocks.content: The scalars in a polynomial algebra are in the subring algebra iff the scalar value is in the subring. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 4-Jul-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm subrgasclcl(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, class c7, class c8, class c9, class c10, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wb(wcel(cfv(c0, c1), c2), wcel(c1, c3)))
  -| wceq(c4, co(c5, cmpl, c6))

  -| wceq(c7, co(c6, cress, c3))

  -| wi(w0, wcel(c3, cfv(csubrg, c6)))
  -| wceq(c2, cfv(cbs, c8))
  -| wceq(c10, cfv(cbs, c6))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c1, c10))
} = {
  impbida(w0, wcel(cfv(c0, c1), c2), wcel(c1, c3))
  eleqtrrd(c1, c3, cfv(cbs, c7), wa(w0, wcel(cfv(c0, c1), c2)))
  rspcdva(hs0, cxp(c5, csn(nat0)), crab(hs1, co(cn0, cmap, c5), wcel(cima(ccnv(cv(hs1)), cn), cfn)), wa(w0, wcel(cfv(c0, c1), c2)), wcel(c1, cfv(cbs, c7)), wcel(cif(c1, cfv(c0g, c6), wceq(cv(hs0), cxp(c5, csn(nat0)))), cfv(cbs, c7)))

blocks.name: mplind
blocks.content: Prove a property of polynomials by "structural" induction, under a simplified model of structure which loses the sum of products structure. The commutativity condition is stronger than strictly needed. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 11-Mar-2015.)
blocks.origin:

blocks.name: mplcoe4
blocks.content: Decompose a polynomial into a finite sum of scaled monomials. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 8-Mar-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm mplcoe4(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, class c7, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wceq(c0, co(c1, cgsu, cmpt(s0, c2, cmpt(s1, c2, cif(cfv(c0, cv(s0)), c3, wceq(cv(s1), cv(s0))))))))
  -| wceq(c1, co(c4, cmpl, c5))
  -| wceq(c2, crab(s2, co(cn0, cmap, c4), wcel(cima(ccnv(cv(s2)), cn), cfn)))
  -| wceq(c3, cfv(c0g, c5))
  -| wceq(c6, cfv(cbs, c1))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c4, c7))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c5, crg))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c0, c6))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s0, s2)

  -| diffsc(s0, c4)
